programmes.show_description: (2018) Emotional drama starring Sienna Miller. A woman must raise her grandson after her daughter disappears. With Christina Hendricks and Aaron Paul.
The Lake District Mountain Rescue Association help the lost, injured and stricken. A man with a dislocated shoulder is stranded at the popular Eskdale Pools. (Ep1/4)
At Nottingham's Queen's Medical Centre, seven-year-old Hunter needs help after falling from a tree. And 45-year-old Kirsty has had an accident at a fun run.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Riley RMF: In Rochdale, Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw fix up a unique British post-war classic: a 1953 Riley RMF that's been handed down from father to son for 70 years.
Plymouth Rocks: Mike falls hard for a 100-year-old turbocharged hotrod. A gigantic garage serves up some sweet deals. And Frank rescues a vintage muscle car from a rusty demise.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Norfolk, Henry Cole chooses a tractor and Simon O'Brien fancies a small-wheeled design classic for restoration.
Guest judges Janet and Philip return to help Max assess the character and comfort of the competitors' libraries, before another pair are eliminated. (Ep14/20)
Paul dreams of owning a Spanish holiday home on the Costa Blanca, where he can spend quality time with family. Are any of the places that Ben Hillman shows him 'the one'?
Annette and Graham explore Spain's northern Costa Blanca to find their dream bolthole for £220k. After a rocky start, is the grass really greener? And will they find their perfect place?
Glasgow. Make-up artist Craig throws a glitz-and-glamour party, complete with edible glitter and sparklers. But his attempt to guess his guests' ages doesn't go down well. (Ep1/5)
Glasgow. Paul serves his guests Balmoral steak with whisky sauce, as well as the mysteriously titled 'Paul's Cream Puff', plus a healthy portion of practical jokes. (Ep2/5)
Glasgow. Dance fanatic Mandy hopes to bag herself the cash prize by hosting a Latin dance fever evening, along with an Asian-inspired menu. But one guest has to run to the bathroom. (Ep3/5)
Glasgow. Music teacher and self-professed cooking queen Siobhan serves up a cod and chorizo stew on her rock and pop icons night - and shows off her piano skills for dessert. (Ep4/5)
Glasgow. It's the final day of the competition and bubbly Caroline hosts a 1970s-themed disco diva party, with a mystery menu, on a night of shocking revelations. (Ep5/5)
Basingstoke. Winery worker Izzy hosts a night of sophistication, but Mark rejects the black-tie dress code. Can she give her guests a night to remember, or is it too much for some? (Ep4/5)
Phil Spencer helps three friends who are searching for a London pad, while Kirstie Allsopp helps newly-weds Daniel and Jennie to find a marital home in north London.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: It's a Cullercoats catch-up, as we see how Mark and Suze are getting on after transforming their topsy-turvy townhouse. Do they still have the renovation bug?
Jamie makes gnarly celeriac skewers, a hearty spiced cauliflower bake complete with an edible lid, a steaming winter chilli, crispy potato and chickpea parcels and soul-warming soup. (Ep6)
A car sale on social media turns into a knife-point carjacking and a high-speed car chase. In Sheffield, the hit-and-run death of an elderly man takes a disturbing twist. (Ep4)
(2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.
This time it's Adolescence, Tribe with Bruce Parry, and Bad Dog Academy. Also Tempting Fortune, The Yorkshire Vet, Million Dollar Secret and ITV News (Greenland/wrestling).
The Goggleboxers watch Gladiators, The Summit, Michael McIntyre's Big Show, Bridgerton, Guy Martin's House without Bills, Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly and BBC News (Mandelson).
The Horror House (Part 2/2): Will the victims of alleged historic child sex abuse finally get justice? Or will the suspect walk free, like he did before?
A car sale on social media turns into a knife-point carjacking and a high-speed car chase. In Sheffield, the hit-and-run death of an elderly man takes a disturbing twist. (Ep4)
...Washington DC: Joe Lycett and Phil Wang enjoy DC's wonders, from the Washington Monument to the Barbie Pond, a secret door experience, a donut tour and a gin rickey in a speakeasy.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Porsche 911 Targa: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Oxfordshire to renovate a rundown 1973 Porsche 911 Targa for Ben, who's had it for 35 years.
Rocket Man: Mike and Frank make a scene when they hit the streets in a one-of-a-kind rocket car. But will the massive price tag send them crashing back down to earth?

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: It's a tank-off as Henry Cole turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit in Oxfordshire, while Simon O'Brien transforms some old tanks into a pizza oven in Liverpool.
The Heat 3 final offers up the most demanding test yet: hosting a refined food and wine night. Only one pair will earn a spot in the final showdown. (Ep15/20)
Ben Hillman helps Lisa and Neil fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home on the Costa Cálida to share with their children. With a budget of £100k, can they find the perfect place?
Shirley and Ken see what Famagusta has to offer for £175k, from a 'hard no' non-starter to two perfect places that have them moving in already. How will they pick between two dream homes?
Reading. Sonya Smith hopes to disguise her lack of cooking ability with her good humour and a 'touch of sparkle'. But with kitchen calamities galore, what will her guests think? (Ep1/5)
Reading. Cockney Glen Wilkie is confident that his menu will be a winner. But his evening goes from disaster to disaster, with tears at the table when he serves his main. (Ep2/5)
Reading. It's all hands on deck as Richard Howse's girlfriend Katy plans his pirate-themed night. But Sonya isn't convinced by the gluten-free fare and Sabi refuses the meaty main. (Ep3/5)
Reading. Sabi Phagura hosts a bhangra-themed evening with traditional Indian food, but can she succeed despite Glen's efforts to wind everyone up? (Ep4/5)
Reading. Corset maker Serine Daou hopes her burlesque night will end the competition on a high. But her gourmet burgers aren't very gourmet, and Glen doesn't like the entertainment. (Ep5/5)
Basingstoke. Chris wraps up the week with a 90s music theme and a 'Franglais' menu. But with simmering tensions between Mark and Izzy, can a lip sync battle win over his guests? (Ep5/5)
In Manchester, Kirstie and Phil help two young first-time buyers who've both agreed to share the home-buying decision-making with their new tenants.
We meet Brixham's maverick skipper who live-streams his latest catch, and a Cornwall engineer gets a replica of the iconic steam locomotive, The Puffing Devil, back up to full steam.
The remaining potters create floral posies and vases, and take on a surprise embellishing challenge. Who'll bloom into the next round, and whose posy isn't all rosy?
In Nottingham, staff at Queen's Medical Centre deal with a crime wave of needle-spiking attacks on female university students, including Kate, who collapsed at a nightclub.
A car sale on social media turns into a knife-point carjacking and a high-speed car chase. In Sheffield, the hit-and-run death of an elderly man takes a disturbing twist. (Ep4)
The Goggleboxers settle down for more of the biggest and best TV. What do they think this time?
